snippet: The lawsuit says current and former executives and board members breached their fiduciary duty in their handling of allegations involving a Mexican subsidiary.
abstract: California State Teachers' Retirement System, one of the nation's largest pension plans, files a lawsuit accusing Wal-Mart's current and former executives and board members of breaching their fiduciary duty in connection with a bribery scandal at the retailer's Mexican subsidiary.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit says current and former executives and board members breached their fiduciary duty in their handling of allegations involving a Mexican subsidiary.

headline.seo: Pension Plan Sues Wal-Mart Officials Over Failures
headline.main: Pension Plan Sues Wal-Mart Officials Over Failures
headline.print_headline: Pension Plan Sues Wal-Mart Officials Over Failures
